techmeme.title: Microsoft lays off 3% of employees across all levels, teams, and geographies "to best position the company"; Microsoft employed 228K at the end of June 2024 (Jordan Novet/CNBC)
Sources: Saudi Arabia's sovereign wealth fund-backed AI company HUMAIN has selected US-based chip developer Groq for its inference work (Kelsey Warner/Semafor)
Elliptic: Colorado-registered Xinbi Guarantee runs a Telegram black market for Chinese crypto scammers that has facilitated $8.4B in transactions since 2022 (Andy Greenberg/Wired)
Intel says it certified Shell's lubricant-based method for cooling AI data center servers more efficiently after a two-year trial, in a bid to use less energy (Mitchell Ferman/Bloomberg)
Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says the company will send AI chips to Saudi Arabia's Humain for a 500 MW data center buildout, as President Trump visits the kingdom (Bloomberg)
